instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP1V8_S3: What is PP1V8_S3? The PP1V8_S3 signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides a voltage of 1.8 volts during the S3 power state. The S3 state, often referred to as "suspend to RAM," is a low-power mode where the computer saves the session's state to RAM, allowing for quicker wake-up times compared to a full shutdown..
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no funciona
threads.message:
Hola amigo buen dia o noche.
Tengo una macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> que al conectar al cargador su ventilador gira pero no da imagen, ni sonido de encendido.
probé desconectando la pantalla y conectándola a un adaptador usbc a hdmi, el procesador llega hasta los 78 grados centigrados, eso marca la camara termica.
realice mediciones en:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 13.09V en escala de diodos .380V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_VSNS_IN</SIGNAL> = 20V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> = 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S3</SIGNAL> = 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0</SIGNAL> = .595V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no funciona
threads.message:
Cual es la tension CPU core despues de unos 10-15 segundos?
Midela en L7210/20.
Deberia caer a 0.65V aprox, cuando la placa realmente arranca.

Algun historial de averia disponible?
Aparte de video externo, has revisado la actividad USB?
Al menos revisa la reaccion de la luz de Caps Lock.

Podrias probar un dump de BIOS 100% bueno.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no funciona
threads.message:
La tension de CPU core  en L7210/20 es de 0.935V, de que manera puedo revisar la actividad usb, no tengo voltimetro usb

el cliente me comenta que antes iniciaba hasta el logo, cargaba la barra y se reiniciaba, y asi un bucle hasta que se apagaba, cuando me la trajo, no mostro la manzana,

caps lock no se ilumina, de echo despues de encender para probar caps lock el ventilador giro todo normal, unos segundos y se apago, ahora 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 11.39V cpu sigue calentando pero el ventilador no gira, reconecte bateria y encendio de nuevo

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no funciona
threads.message:
No hace falta revisar nada mas, si la tension CPU core se queda en 0.9V; la placa queda colgada, no arranca (solo enciende).
Podrias probar BIOS de todo modo.
Aunque sospecho que CPU esta mal.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no funciona
threads.message: perfecto, investigare sobre algún tutorial para cargarle el bios, supongo no debe ser muy diferente a macbook del 2012
